intro: Polydiclis multivalvis, commonly known as the multivalved polydiclis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
